Articles.Content:
So, I'm currently having a problem where I cannot unlock parts in the R&D center after installing the mod, and parts that should be added by things like contracts are not showing up. Only happens after installing KAS. Anyone else have this happen?

KAS uses ModuleManager to alter stock parts. I suspect you have a duplicate copy of KAS in your install. Duplicates of the same parts can cause them to not unlock and you'll end up with multiple copies in your tech tree.

KAS uses ModuleManager to alter stock parts. I suspect you have a duplicate copy of KAS in your install. Duplicates of the same parts can cause them to not unlock and you'll end up with multiple copies in your tech tree.

Just checked, no duplicated install. Just the one.
Can u add some pics for this post? I think, it will be better. Of course a lot of people know about it, but somebody isn't, and it'll help.

Is it possible to attach things to a winch, for example, in the editor?

Edit: I figured it out, I had to use a stack winch port instead of a radial one.

Edited October 5, 2014 by Albin Xavier

I wonder if it is known that grabbing a strutted container causes mild spinning and destruction, for I have awakened the KAS kraken

Edited October 7, 2014 by PanWieldingMann
kerbalizing the sentence structure
Great mod, something like this should be stock!
hrm just spent ~10 mins looking for this thread... Welcome Back Kospy
Are there any issues in .25?

Are there any issues in .25?

.25 has been out less then a day. Let the modders test. awesome will flow.

now if i could convince steam to stop updating automatically on me, i'd be happier.

now if i could convince steam to stop updating automatically on me, i'd be happier.

Yeah sadly Steam only has options for Always Update, or Update on Launch.

Best way is to copy the game out of your Steam folder to a new location.

If you want Steam to continue to keep track of it though, you can just change the launch options to point it to the new copy you have saved off. If you want these options, I can post them up

.25 has been out less then a day. Let the modders test. awesome will flow.

I have seen this post on multiple mod threads. Awesome only flows after we ask questions and find answers. The modders themselves don't necessarily need to intervene in order for us to find awesomeness.

I have seen this post on multiple mod threads. Awesome only flows after we ask questions and find answers. The modders themselves don't necessarily need to intervene in order for us to find awesomeness.

If you really believe this, then submit pull requests.

Modders are aware that KSP is out. Some mods take longer than others to update. KAS has a large support net, so it will be updated soon either way. Have patience.

If you really believe this, then submit pull requests.

Modders are aware that KSP is out. Some mods take longer than others to update. KAS has a large support net, so it will be updated soon either way. Have patience.

I am in no rush, just trying to stick up for people who are asking about compatibility while pointing out that the community can test compatibility too. Some mods will work without the modder having to make a new release. Thus yes, I do believe my statement.

I am in no rush, just trying to stick up for people who are asking about compatibility while pointing out that the community can test compatibility too. Some mods will work without the modder having to make a new release. Thus yes, I do believe my statement.

so there are three options, 1) Be Patient and polite (see Majiir's recommendations) 2) Help (see github) or 3) get out of the way (see Wheaton's Law)

1) Be Patient and polite

So far, I haven't seen anybody being impatient or impolite here, at least in this particular thread. Nobody is saying 'give me the update now!'. They've politely asked if the current version is compatible with 0.25. This is a reasonable question, given that there's likely to be someone who's actually tried running the mod in 0.25. Keep an open mind, and don't let those who have been rude (be it in other threads or previous updates) bias you against simple questions.
You can find out faster by doing it yourself. Replies on a forum can take hours or days.
Just letting y'all know that KAS 0.4.8 is non-compatible with KSP version 0.25.0. At least, the game didn't like it when I tried to fire it up with KAS installed.
Same here!

Just letting y'all know that KAS 0.4.8 is non-compatible with KSP version 0.25.0. At least, the game didn't like it when I tried to fire it up with KAS installed.

The compatibility checker that pops up right as the main menu shows up doesn't necessarily mean much. The game's just checking the version of the game that the mod said it was compatible with when it was released. It's entirely possible that the mod will function fine with the new version of KSP, it's just giving you a heads up that it might not.

Yeah sadly Steam only has options for Always Update, or Update on Launch.

Is this only for KSP?

I havent checked the auto-update tab for KSP in steam because I make it a habit of doing a backup of the whole KSP folder everyday (lost it once, shame on them, etc.) but there is usually an option to disable updates from downloading outright.
One bug I've found so far is that I can't get items out of a storage box in EVA. This is the same bug that popped up a wee while ago that was fixed when the recompiled .dll was released as a hotfix.

Is this only for KSP?

I havent checked the auto-update tab for KSP in steam because I make it a habit of doing a backup of the whole KSP folder everyday (lost it once, shame on them, etc.) but there is usually an option to disable updates from downloading outright.

when you right click your KSP on you game list

yeah its under properties, updates tab, under the automatic updates you can select the drop-down that you'd like to use.

I Have had no trouble with a RECOMPILED KAS on 0.25 (linux). KospY is aware of the need to recompile (I told him) and is likely updating KSP and testing.

Crazy emphasis because too many people just don't read .
Can you share it? (I think the license exception for recompiling when a new version happens was sorted a whle ago)

The compatibility checker that pops up right as the main menu shows up doesn't necessarily mean much. The game's just checking the version of the game that the mod said it was compatible with when it was released. It's entirely possible that the mod will function fine with the new version of KSP, it's just giving you a heads up that it might not.

Alright, thanks. I did note as I got into the game that the KAS parts were still present in the VAB and SPH; I did not, however, attempt to use any KAS parts in that initial run. If there's still a question of whether or not KSP is just being KSP this evening, I'll do a more thorough test. Running the game in Win7 if that's at all helpful.
